intro: Pasania glaberrima, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features showy, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale blue, blooming in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Pasania glaberrima thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and woodland habitats.
